m_szDocSumamry: Cactus Skin Could Improve Fuel Cell Performance April 29th, 2016 by Steve Hanley     Researchers from the  Commonwealth Scientific and Industrial Research Organisation in Australia and  Hanyang University in Korea have published a report in Nature this week that promises greater efficiency for fuel cells. Yes, we know that fuel cell cars won’t be a practical alternative to electric cars until someone figures out how to extract hydrogen from water or hydrocarbons without using less energy than the liberated hydrogen has to offer, but that is a subject for someone else to research.
